metadata.titleEn: Multi-scale surface flux and meteorological elements observation dataset in the Hai River BasinÂ (Huailai station-automatic weather station-10m tower, 2016)
metadata.description:
The data set contains the observation data of 10m tower self-moving meteorological station on January 1, 2016, solstice, December 31, 2016.The station is located in east garden town, huailai county, hebei province.The latitude and longitude of the observation point is 115.7880E, 40.3491N, and the altitude is 480m.
The automatic weather station is installed on a 10m tower, the acquisition frequency is 30s, and the output time is 10min.The observation factors include air temperature and relative humidity (5m), and the direction is due north.The wind speed (10m), the wind direction (10m), the direction is due to the north;Air pressure (installed in waterproof box);Rainfall (10m);The four-component radiation (5m), the direction is due to the south;The infrared surface temperature (5m), the arm is facing south, and the probe is facing vertically downward.The soil temperature and humidity probe was buried at 1.5m to the south of the meteorological tower. The buried depth of the soil temperature probe was 0cm, 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 20cm, 40cm, 80cm, 120cm and 160cm. The buried depth of the soil moisture sensor was 2cm, 4cm, 10cm, 10cm, 10cm, 10cm, 20cm, 80cm, 120cm and 160cm.The average soil temperature was buried 2,4 cm underground.Soil hot flow plates (3) are buried in the ground 6cm.
Processing and quality control of observation data :(1) ensure 144 data per day (every 10min). If data is missing, it will be marked by -6999;(2) eliminate the moments with duplicate records;(3) data that is obviously beyond the physical meaning or the range of the instrument is deleted;(4) the format of date and time is unified, and the date and time are in the same column.For example, the time is: 2016-6-10-10:30.During January 1, solstice, April 15, there was a problem with the soil temperature sensor with a depth of 40cm, and the data was missing.
Guo et al, 2020 is used for site introduction and Liu et al, 2013 for data processing
metadata.instructions:
File naming method: **** station-#### station-xx tower-yyyy, where **** represents the site name, #### # represents the site type, xx represents the tower height (meters), yyyy represents the data observation year
Data usage: this data is tabular data, which can be opened and viewed by WPS, Ecxel and other software

Feature Specification.Question: What are the characteristics of a dataset collected from an automatic weather station installed on a 10m tower in an agricultural area?
Feature Specification.Answer: air temperature and relative humidity at 5m, wind speed and direction at 10m, atmospheric pressure, rainfall at 10m, four components of radiation at 5m, infrared surface temperature, soil temperature and moisture at various depths, data collected every 30 seconds, data output every 10 minutes, located in a cornfield in Huailai County, Hebei Province, precise geographic coordinates, elevation

Quantification.Question: How many data points are collected on a daily basis in an automatic meteorological station dataset observing air temperature and humidity, wind speed and direction, and other meteorological elements?

Definition.Question: What does 'multi-scale surface flux and meteorological element observation' mean in the context of environmental data collection?
Definition.Answer: Multi-scale surface flux and meteorological element observation refers to the systematic collection and analysis of various atmospheric and soil-related parameters at different spatial or temporal scales. This includes measuring air temperature, humidity, wind speed and direction, atmospheric pressure, precipitation, radiation components, surface temperature, soil heat flux, and soil moisture and temperature at multiple depths to understand the interactions between the atmosphere and the Earth's surface.

Instrumental/Procedural.Question: What are the procedural steps involved in ensuring the accuracy and reliability of meteorological and soil data collected by an automatic weather station installed on a 10m tower?
Instrumental/Procedural.Answer: The data processing and quality control steps include: (1) Ensuring there are 144 data points per day (every 10 minutes), with missing data marked as -6999; (2) Removing duplicate records; (3) Deleting data points that are clearly outside the physical range or instrument limits; (4) Standardizing date and time format, with date and time in the same column, e.g., 2016-6-10 10:30. Additionally, for the period from January 1 to April 15, the 40cm depth soil temperature sensor data is missing due to sensor issues.
